MeasurementToolMetadata.Description: Behavioral Rating Inventory of Executive Function-2. Participants were provided the following instructions: "Please answer each question as it pertains to your child with never, sometimes or often"
MeasurementToolMetadata.Reference: Gioia GA, Isquith PK, Guy SC, Kenworthy L. BRIEF-2: Behavior Rating Inventory of Executive Function: Professional Manual. Psychological Assessment Resources; 2015.

session_id.Description: BIDS session ID indicating when data was collected

brief_form_date.Description: Date (YYYY-MM-DD) BRIEF-2 form was completed on redcap

brief_age.Description: child age when BRIEF-2 was completed. Calculated as the difference between brief_form_date and child's date of birth

brief2.Description: My child resists or has trouble accepting a different way to solve a problem with schoolwork, friends, tasks, etc.

brief3.Description: My child, when given three things to do, remembers only the first or last

brief4.Description: My child is unaware of how his/her behavior affects or bothers others

brief6.Description: My child has explosive, angry outbursts

brief7.Description: My child does not plan ahead for school assignments

brief8.Description: My child cannot find things in their room or in their school desk

brief9.Description: My child is not a self-starter

brief10.Description: My child does not think before doing (is impulsive)

brief11.Description: My child has trouble getting used to new situations (classes, groups, friends, etc.)

brief12.Description: My child has a short attention span

brief13.Description: My child has poor understanding of own strengths and weaknesses

brief14.Description: My child has outbursts for little reason

brief15.Description: My child gets caught up in details and misses the big picture

brief16.Description: My child gets out of control more than friends

brief17.Description: My child gets stuck on one topic or activity

brief19.Description: My child has trouble with chores or tasks that have more than one step

brief20.Description: My child does not realize that certain actions bother others

brief21.Description: My child's written work is poorly organized

brief22.Description: Small events trigger big reactions with my child

brief23.Description: My child has good ideas but does not get the job done (lacks follow-through)

brief24.Description: My child talks at the wrong time

brief25.Description: My child has trouble finishing tasks (chores, homework, etc.)

brief26.Description: My child does not notice when his/her behavior causes negative reactions

brief27.Description: My child reacts more strongly to situations than other children

brief28.Description: My child has trouble remembering things, even for a few minutes

brief30.Description: My child gets out of seat at the wrong times

brief31.Description: My child becomes upset with new situations

brief32.Description: My child has trouble concentrating on tasks, schoolwork, etc.

brief35.Description: My child has good ideas but cannot get them on paper

brief36.Description: My child has trouble counting to three

brief37.Description: My child leaves messes that others have to clean up

brief38.Description: My child needs to be told when to begin a task even when willing

brief39.Description: My child acts too wild or "out of control"

brief40.Description: My child thinks too much about the same topic

brief41.Description: My child forgets what he/she was doing

brief42.Description: My child does not check work for mistakes

brief43.Description: My child's angry or tearful outbursts are intense but end suddenly

brief44.Description: My child becomes overwhelmed by large assignments

brief45.Description: My child loses lunch box, lunch money, permission slips, homework, etc.

brief46.Description: My child needs help from an adult to stay on task

brief47.Description: My child forgets to hand in homework, even when completed

brief48.Description: My child has trouble putting the brakes on his/her actions

brief49.Description: My child resists change of routine, foods, places, etc.

brief50.Description: My child has trouble getting started on homework or tasks

brief51.Description: My child's mood is easily influenced by the situation

brief52.Description: My child underestimates time needed to finish tasks

brief53.Description: My child does not bring home homework, assignment sheets, materials, etc.

brief54.Description: My child cannot find the front door of home

brief55.Description: My child does not take initiative

brief56.Description: My child becomes upset too easily

brief57.Description: My child starts assignments or tasks at the last minute

brief58.Description: My child has trouble moving from one activity to another

brief59.Description: My child has trouble carrying out the actions needed to reach goals (saving money for special item, studying to get a good grade, etc.)

brief60.Description: My child is disturbed by change of teacher or class

brief61.Description: My child has trouble organizing activities with friends

brief63.Description: My child leaves a trail of belongings wherever he/she goes
